SharkPort and XPort Not Compatible With New, Slim PS2!
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Coliseum (Public Monster Rancher Tournaments): The Locker Room (Q&A): SharkPort and XPort Not Compatible With New, Slim PS2!
By Lisa Shock on Friday, December 17, 2004 - 10:23 pm:

I've gotten confirmation that the disc you place inside the PS2 for using SP/XP is not compatible with the new slim PS2. I am working on getting word about Max Drive compatibility.

By The D on Saturday, December 18, 2004 - 03:08 pm:

By Lisa Shock on Thursday, December 23, 2004 - 11:45 am:

Hotmail does not allow them to be sent, as well as not allowing them to be opened once they are in an inbox. I sent half a dozen tests out of my real email box because hotmail wouldn't not let me send them. My real email worked fine, but it's already overflowing with real world stuff. This was when we discovered that the shaw.ca cable service also does not allow them to be sent or received.

If a couple people with yahoo boxes want to test this that would be great. I also need to test my gmail. My gmail address is:
monster.rancher.metropolis (at) gmail.com
(replace the (at) with @ and get rid of the spaces -and yes, gmail uses dots instead of dashes, keep the periods)

You can send me any sort of .sps or .xps or max drive save. Just write 'test' in the text of the message (give it some sort of subject so it isn't filtered as junk, "Lisa here is your copy") and I will know and delete the save if it arrives safely.

By Eric B on Thursday, December 30, 2004 - 04:35 pm:

Lisa, why not just email the files to yourself. That way you don't need to relay between people, plus you obviously have a sharkport so you can test it yourself.

By Lisa Shock on Thursday, December 30, 2004 - 05:04 pm:

Because, as I stated before, some ISP emails are seeing the files as viruses (shaw in canada for one), and I figured that some people might want to test their ISP or other email services that I personally don't have. I don't have a Yahoo email, and there are dozens of freemail providers out there, all over the globe. There are dozens of US ISPs. I don't live in the right geographical area to have access to Roadrunner and the like, and I can't afford to join AOL, PeoplePC Online, Netscape, Netzero, etc. just for this test.

By RPGProgrammer on Wednesday, January 5, 2005 - 06:15 pm:

I beg to differ regarding the slim PS2's lack of compatibility with the X-Port. I tried it myself a day or so ago, and it worked just fine. As for the SharkPort, I haven't the foggiest, as I lack one.

Oh, if you're interested, we have a special X-Port/Max Drive save converter available for download at the RPG Maker community main site, The RPG Maker Pavilion.

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, January 5, 2005 - 06:31 pm:

I have seen the converter, I just haven't had the time to test it myself. I would appreciate anyone submitting saves converting them to .max for me. I hate the sp/xp.

As for the incompatibilty, I went and asked at several forums, including the gameshark site and Datel's tech support (after reading several topics at gamefaqs where users complained), and everyone said they didn't work, that the slim ps2 wouldn't read the ps2 disc.

By RPGProgrammer on Wednesday, January 5, 2005 - 06:49 pm:

Perhaps mine worked fine due to the fact that mine is a slightly older model. Ah, no use looking a gift horse in the mouth.
